intro: Stigmaphyllon grenadense, commonly known as the Grenada stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Grenada. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are palmate, with five to seven lobes, and it produces small, hairy fruits that contain seeds. Stigmaphyllon grenadense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
